snippet.textDisplay: it's fucking excellent, even if you didn't grow up with it (I played it for the first time last year). you should absolutely play it as blind as possible.
snippet.textOriginal: it's fucking excellent, even if you didn't grow up with it (I played it for the first time last year). you should absolutely play it as blind as possible.

snippet.textDisplay:
Violet - Wolf In my opinion, it's the best RPG on the SNES, maybe one of the best of all time. It's hard to explain what makes it so good because there are a lot of amazing things, from the awesome gameplay mechanics, to the great characters with compelling storylines, to the well written main plot, to the soundtrack, to the fact that the art was done by Akira freaking Toriyama.
I'd love to go into detail on all of this, but it would take too much time, so instead I'd recomend you check out ProJared's review of the game, it will tell you all you need to know.
snippet.textOriginal:
Violet - Wolf In my opinion, it's the best RPG on the SNES, maybe one of the best of all time. It's hard to explain what makes it so good because there are a lot of amazing things, from the awesome gameplay mechanics, to the great characters with compelling storylines, to the well written main plot, to the soundtrack, to the fact that the art was done by Akira freaking Toriyama.
I'd love to go into detail on all of this, but it would take too much time, so instead I'd recomend you check out ProJared's review of the game, it will tell you all you need to know.

snippet.textDisplay:
I BLAME 4KIDS!
Really, though. Since so many of the early childish localization attempts were so bad, people are afraid to try anything creative with their translations anymore... I know there are a lot of purists who think that's for the best, but I'm like, deal with it!
Maybe that's irrelevant. If it is, then I say to you, Oops.
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay: No, in the DS version he just speaks straight English, which is apparently more "accurate" to the "original version" (TIP: I don't give a damn, I liked Square a lot more before I knew the Japanese versions of their games were all overdramatic, self-pity parties) where Frog has no special accent.  Woolsey added it because he thought it would add to the character and in my opinion it did.  It illustrated how hard he was trying to be a proper knight like his idol Cyrus.  Now he's just a frog.
snippet.textOriginal: No, in the DS version he just speaks straight English, which is apparently more "accurate" to the "original version" (TIP: I don't give a damn, I liked Square a lot more before I knew the Japanese versions of their games were all overdramatic, self-pity parties) where Frog has no special accent.  Woolsey added it because he thought it would add to the character and in my opinion it did.  It illustrated how hard he was trying to be a proper knight like his idol Cyrus.  Now he's just a frog.

snippet.textDisplay: Everything is the same except some of the end-game content is new (you can tell because the level design is a lot worse) and all the text is different. The overall plot is the same but the lines are all changed and that changed the personalities and overall atmosphere of the story. The DS version is a lot darker and more depressing than the original, Frog lost his accent which makes him a blander character, and Magus is less badass wizard, more crazy doomsayer. The original was much less serious
snippet.textOriginal: Everything is the same except some of the end-game content is new (you can tell because the level design is a lot worse) and all the text is different. The overall plot is the same but the lines are all changed and that changed the personalities and overall atmosphere of the story. The DS version is a lot darker and more depressing than the original, Frog lost his accent which makes him a blander character, and Magus is less badass wizard, more crazy doomsayer. The original was much less serious

snippet.textDisplay: It wasn't the original though.  Nearly every line of text was rewritten, and the new content ruined the wonderful ending with that stupid Dalton twist.  Seriously?  Dalton?  I don't want to give any spoilers but Chrono Cross was terrible and Trigger was a much, much better game before it existed.

snippet.textDisplay:
Yeah. What's strange though is unlike Chrono Trigger whom thankfully has shown up on PSN and Virtual Console, Konami has released Suikoden I on PSN, when no one asked for it, but not Suikoden II, which everyone requests and wants to try.
Maybe it'll arrive eventually, it gets better and better(recently they FINALLY decided to release Legend of Dragoon, another title that was due ages ago but never showed up).
